intro: Tibouchina, commonly known as the "butterfly bush," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly South America. The plants typically have showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, red, and purple. Tibouchina species are often shrubs or small trees, characterized by opposite, ovate leaves and a tendency to produce dense clusters of flowers. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
